Northern Trail Outfitters uses a custom object to track travel requests. Rangers want to have automatic posts on a record whenever a travel request has been approved.

Which feature should be used to accomplish this?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
https://quizlet.com/732721988/app-builder-2022-flash-cards/
https://help.salesforce.com/s/articleView?id=sf.collab_feed_tracking_overview.htm&type=5

A.
https://help.salesforce.com/s/articleView?id=sf.collab_feed_tracking_overview.htm&type=5

A.
Feed tracking allows you to track changes and updates on records and display them in the Chatter feed. By enabling feed tracking on the custom object used to track travel requests and configuring the appropriate fields, you can automatically generate posts in the Chatter feed whenever a travel request is approved. This will provide the desired automatic posts for the rangers. A Workflow would also meet this requirement but requires extra delarative programming and maintenance whereas a simple Feed Tracking on the required Object and it's field will suffice.

questions.question_text:
Universal Containers is setting up Salesforce for the first time. Management wants the sales and marketing teams to have different navigation menus in the
Salesforce Mobile App.
What option is available to an app builder to satisfy this requirement?

choices.D: Create roles for sales and marketing and assign a custom homepage layout for each role.
choices.B: Create mobile navigation menus for both the sales and marketing profiles.
choices.A: Create sales and marketing profiles and ensure read access to different objects.
choices.C: Create public groups for sales and marketing and create mobile navigation menus for each group.

discussion.content: This is because you cannot set different configurations menu for several kinds of users.

Selected Answer: A
I think A. 
Navigation Menu includes Anything represented by a tab in Salesforce (such as standard/custom objects, Visualforce pages, the Chatter feed, People, or Groups) is visible for a user in the Salesforce mobile app menu, based on the user’s profile settings. 

 For example, if a user is assigned to a profile that has the Groups tab set to Tab Hidden, the user won’t see the Groups menu item in the Salesforce mobile app navigation menu, even though an admin has included it in the menu.
B is correct answer.

I will also support A but typically Salesforce have not worded this Q very well, because A results in Read Access and the requirements do not mention read only access. But, when configuring usinf profiles, we can set the access levels for the team to read only, read write etc anyway.

A is correct answer, because you can add objects to navigation menu on S1 app. If the profile can access to this object, then you can it otherwise you can not see. A said they access to difference objects will make this logic work.

A. Tabs/Objects are controlled by Profiles.
Anything represented by a tab in Salesforce—such as standard and custom objects, Visualforce pages, the Chatter feed, People, or Groups—is visible for a user in the Salesforce mobile app menu, based on the user’s profile settings. For example, if a user is assigned to a profile that has the Groups tab set to Tab Hidden, the user won’t see the Groups menu item in the Salesforce mobile app navigation menu, even though an admin has included it in the menu.

A. The selected objects in the sandbox template. 

A partial copy sandbox can only copy 10,000 records per object or per master/detail relationship. 

If the custom object Shipping is a child object or even a grandchild object it's possible that the parent or even the grandparent of shipping has already used all the random 10,000 records that can be selected for these objects. The fact that the question says this object has 2 million records helps us assume that the other objects probably also have a large number of records as well.

"Since the sampling starts at the parent object, it could be possible that the child or grandchild objects may come back with little to *zero* records."
https://help.salesforce.com/s/articleView?id=000386381&type=1

A.
The reason the data is missing from the partial sandbox could be due to the selected objects in the sandbox template. The app builder may have omitted the Shipping custom object when creating the sandbox, resulting in no data being transferred to the partial sandbox. Additionally, if the partial sandbox was refreshed too early, the data transfer process may not have completed.

choices.D: The sandbox was refreshed too early.
choices.B: The partial sandbox is at capacity.
choices.C: The sandbox is still populating data.
choices.A: The selected objects in the sandbox template.
